meanings.sent1: She is a gregarious person who enjoys spending time with friends.
meanings.sent2: The gregarious student always sat with different classmates during lunch.
meanings.sent3: The gregarious puppy wagged its tail happily as it greeted everyone at the park.
meanings.sent4: The gregarious flowers in the garden seemed to be chatting with each other in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: His gregarious nature made him the life of the party wherever he went.

meanings.definition: Living in flocks or loosely organized communities.
meanings.sent1: Birds are gregarious creatures that often fly together in large groups.
meanings.sent2: The gregarious monkeys swung from tree to tree in their lively community.
meanings.sent3: The gregarious fish in the aquarium seemed to be having a group meeting near the coral reef.
meanings.sent4: The gregarious ants worked together in perfect harmony to build their intricate underground tunnels.
meanings.sent5: The gregarious sheep roamed the fields in a peaceful herd, grazing together under the sun.
